Posts.Content: You must be so worried. I know a lady who is always getting benign lumps in her breasts. I don't know but I think once you've had one you are more likely to get more. Good luck.
Posts.Title: Another lump and scared

Posts.Content: When you said it moves around it reminded me of my niece who at 17 had quite a large lump removed from her breast. The pathology showed it to be what they call a mouse lump, I don't know the correct medical term for it, it's called that because it moves around. She was told it was harmless but she will possibly get more.
Posts.Title: Another lump and scared

Posts.Content: It sounds to me like your breast pain is hormonal, it's normal and very common. Stress can certainly effect your period. I use to completely miss periods when I was stressed. Hormonal changes can also effect the flow. While I agree with the previous poster you should never ignore symptoms, breast cancer is very uncommon in young women especially when it's not genetic. In Australia 2% of breast cancer diagnosis are in women between 20 and 34. I think the reason young women are becoming more alert to it is because some high profile young women have had it. Best wishes.
Posts.Title: pain under my left breast :( - what could it be?

Posts.Content: Every mammo I've had the tech has called me back to repeat one of the views. She explained they have a quick look to make sure they're clear enough for the radiologist to read accurately. They also always put me in the most painful position so they get a good picture of the lymph glands. I doubt very much a tech could read the pictures. Radiologists are highly trained to do this. I think it would have to be something very obvious, to you also, if she picked something up from a quick look. I really don't think you need worry.
Posts.Title: HELP - mammogram tech scared me!

Posts.Content: This finding is not alarming and is most often benign....but it's always advisable to have a biopsy to be on the safe side. I'm sure your results will be fine.
Posts.Title: 2.3 cm hypoechoic mass?
